document_data.name: Shalara Swordshigh
document_data.titles:
[[High Heralds|High Herald]]
Member at Large of the [[Council of the Marches]]
document_data.refs35: <ref group="note">This is one of those rare instances when an NPC was described in both a 3rd edition and a v.3.5 source. The v.3.5 class levels are used for the categories, which do not distinguish between 3rd edition and 3.5.
document_data.text: Set aside your differences, and we may build something far stronger than the mightiest army, something that will outlast us all.
document_data.mainbody: Shalara was promoted to the office of Old Night after her predecessor, [[Haemar the Old]], died sometime between the [[1356 DR|Year of the Worm, 1356 DR]] and the [[1368 DR|Year of the Banner, 1368 DR]], She belonged to Lady [[Alustriel Silverhand]]'s [[Council of 12 Peers]] which helped rule the [[Silver Marches]] around [[1370 DR]]. If Lady Alustriel died, Old Night would act as High Lady until the Council voted on a new ruler of the Silver Marches.
document_data.Personality: Quiet-spoken, Old Night Shalara said almost nothing in Council of 12 Peers meetings, except to provide lore and information on current situations in [[the North]]. She could perfectly recall and quote all the words spoken by the other Peers back at them, but played no favorites.  She merely strove for clarity in thought and argument.
document_data.Possessions: Shalara customarily wore ''[[bracers of armor]] +4'' and carried a rusty iron sphere (''[[iron bands of Bilarro]]'') at her belt.
